intro: Amyema oligantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lilly pilly, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for use as a hedge or ornamental plant in gardens. Amyema oligantha is also valued for its ability to attract native birds and insects.
